summary: A letter from attorneys Michael C. Miller and Martin G. Weinberg, representing the estate of Jeffrey Epstein, to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York. The letter formally requests specific documents and records from the DOJ related to Epstein's death in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 10, 2019, citing serious irregularities and the need for their own investigation.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein in Custody
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell in the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) at approximately 6:30 a.m. from an apparent suicide. He was transported to a hospital and pronounced dead.

events.title: Attorney General Barr Comments on Irregularities
events.description: Attorney General William Barr stated publicly that the DOJ was "learning of serious irregularities" at the MCC facility surrounding Epstein's death, demanding a thorough investigation.

keyFacts: Attorneys for Jeffrey Epstein's estate are formally requesting specific evidence from the DOJ regarding his death, including video recordings, entry/exit logs, and guard logs from the MCC for August 9-10, 2019.
The letter cites serious concerns about "irregularities" at the MCC, echoing public statements made by Attorney General William Barr.
Jeffrey Epstein died in federal custody at the MCC on August 10, 2019, while awaiting trial on federal charges (Case No. 19-CRIM-00490).
The FBI was investigating the incident at the time of the letter, and the NYC Medical Examiner's office had initially delayed releasing a cause of death.
The document establishes that Epstein's legal team, acting on behalf of his estate, initiated an independent investigation into the circumstances of his death.
